instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .

threads.title: Steps to Diagnose a Macbook Logic Board
threads.message:
Hi,

Potentially this can become a sticky

I was wondering what is the step by step process to diagnosing a macbook logic board.

What main rails are required in which order.

TIA

threads.title: Steps to Diagnose a Macbook Logic Board
threads.message: First we need to know what is the problem, each case is different.......

threads.title: Steps to Diagnose a Macbook Logic Board
threads.message:
This is a very general question and a book can be written on this subject. Best is to watch all Louis's videos as 90% is explained right there.
Short version is: PP3V42 -> green light -> PPVRTC -> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> -> <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> and all other S3 and S0 rails should follow. CPU Vcore will be the last one to come on before reset is released and CPU starts executing code.

threads.title: Steps to Diagnose a Macbook Logic Board
threads.message: Go watch literally any of Louis's videos, and you'll more than likely hear this covered.

threads.title: Steps to Diagnose a Macbook Logic Board
threads.message: thanks duke. thats wht i was looking for.
